ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to define specific weight to be used for payments in the payments hub. Apart from assigning weights for a payment (H- Heavy, M - Medium or L - Light), specific weight can be assigned to a payment to enforce special processing rules. A Heavy weight payment with a specific weight can attract a special fee for instance.
The configurations will be done through the PP.SPECIFIC.WEIGHT screen and saved into PPL.SPECIFICWEIGHT table.

desc.p: Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field 'CompanyID' in PPT.COMPANY.
Specifies the source through which the payment hub receives a message.
The value links to the field 'OriginatingSource' in PPT.SOURCE table
Indicates the message type of the payment for which the defined specific weight will be applicable.
The value links to field 'MsgPaymentType' in PPT.MSGPAYMENTTYPE. Wildcard ‘*’ is acceptable which denotes all message types.
This field is used to maintain a distinction between returns / refunds and normal incoming credit transfers / direct debits
The value links to the field 'ClearingTransactionType' in PPT.TRANSACTIONTYPES table. Wildcard ‘*’ is acceptable which denotes all transaction types.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
11 characters Date format should be entered.
Default value defined as Current Business Date.
Start Date must be less than End Date.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
The specific weight code that needs to be applied based on the originating source, message type and ranking.
Describes the specific weight code defined.
Indicates the weight code for which a specific weight code is defined.
Indicates the instance to be used for Auto Repair of a payment.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
11 characters Date format should be entered.
End Date must be greater than Start Date.
